Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2008 06:36AM lns2119 wrote: I also went to my breast surgeon because of breast pain.  She did not feel any lumps and tried to reassure me that vary rarely was breast pain indicative of breast cancer.  Hormonal changes can be the caused.  However, it can't hurt to check it out.  If you are not confident with your docter's recommendations - get a 2nd opinion!

Having mass removed next week lns2119 LaughingWater

Posts.Content: lns2119 wrote: My yearly mammogram showed an 8 mm mass.  The ultrasound was negative so the radiologist wants it out, saying he can't confirm that it is benign.  Wondering if I am not being told the entire story as why not do a biopsy.  Could it be that it is too small to biopsy?  Anyway, the surgeon will remove it next week.  A wire has to be inserted to identify the location of the mass.  How painful is that?  Is any anesthesia used?  Somehow this seems a bit barbaric.  Haven't told the adult children yet.  Not sure when is a good time - if any time is really good!  Any suggestions for getting thru this 'wire pre-op procedure? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Having mass removed next week lns2119 LaughingWater

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 11:50PM lns2119 wrote: Thanks for all your comments and support.  The wire guided biopsy was so easy.  I can't believe how sick I made myself over this fast procedure.  The radiologist got the needle thru the mass on her first attempt.  The Jefferson Hopsital crew was fabulous.  After 24 hrs, I was to remove the bandages from the excisional (sp) biopsy.  I was so afraid of what I would find due to comments made to me by some 'personal' friends.  The incision was small - no black/blue lumps etc.  Of course waiting really ....well I don't have to tell you.  But thanks for all your support.  I don't know how I would have gotten thru - even just to this point - w/o your help!
Posts.Title: Having mass removed next week lns2119 LaughingWater

Posts.Content: lns2119 wrote: I wanted to see my path report even though the surgeon said everything seemed to be fine but that I neede another mammogram in 3 months.  this concerned me.  There were 2 specimens.  First one was benign.  The 2nd specimen was also benigh breast teasue but shows a clustered group of benign apocrine microcysts with apocrine epithelial hyperplasia at the edge of the specimen.  A clinical/radiographic correlation is required to determine if this clustered group of benign apocrine microcysts is the mammographic lesion in question. mammoggraphic lesion in question.  Can anyone tell me what the heck was said in the report??? Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2008 08:41AM lns2119 wrote: I too am waiting for the results of a biopsy.  I was so anxious about having a needle guided wire procedure that I ordered meditation tapes for medical procedures by Bellaruth Naparstek. It truly got me thru the 2 weeks before the procedure and thru the actual surgery.  I now find myself using the tapes to relax everyday. Everyone in this room has been so helpful.  Sit back, think positive (a difficult task - but doable) and breathe!
